text: Vittorio Blanseri ( 1735–1775) (or Blancheri) was an Italian painter, born at Venice. He trained with the Cavalière Claudio Beaumont, and succeeded him in the service of the court of Turin. He painted a St Louis fainting, supported by an angel for the church of San Pelagio. ==References== * Category:1735 births Category:1775 deaths Category:People from Venice Category:18th-century Italian painters Category:Italian male painters Category:Venetian painters Category:Piedmontese painters
title: Vittorio Blanseri
